data: OB Preterm Premature Rupture of Membranes (PPROM) (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
If suspected Preterm Labour (preterm labour is at least 4 contractions in 20 minutes with cervical change) complete Preterm Labour Module
Admission for Preterm Premature Rupture of Membranes (PPROM) at 24+0 to 36+6 weeks gestation

From 22+0 to 23+6 weeks gestation, where available, consult with Neonatology and/or Maternal Fetal Medicine to individualize management in the peri-viable period for both latency antibiotics and/or corticosteroid administration
Medications
Choose ONE of the following 5 options
Option 1 - If patient has no penicillin allergy AND is Group B streptococcus positive, negative or unknown
ampicillin
2,000 mg, IV, q6h, order duration: 48 hour
erythromycin
250 mg, IV, q6h, order duration: 48 hour, drug form: inj
amoxicillin
250 mg, PO, q8h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: cap
erythromycin EC
333 mg, PO, q8h, order duration: 5 day, drug form: cap
Option 2 - If patient has an allergy to penicillin AND is GBS positive or unknown

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
ceFAZolin
2,000 mg, IV, once, drug form: bag, first dose: NOW
ceFAZolin
1,000 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 5 doses or times, drug form: bag
erythromycin EC
333 mg, PO, q8h, order duration: 10 day, drug form: cap
Option 3 -  If patient has an allergy to penicillin AND is GBS negative
erythromycin EC
333 mg, PO, q8h, order duration: 10 day, drug form: cap

Option 4 - If patient has allergy to cefazolin or severe delayed reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) AND GBS unknown or documented resistance to clindamycin
vancomycin
1,000 mg, IV, q12h, order duration: 4 doses or times
erythromycin EC
333 mg, PO, q8h, order duration: 10 day, drug form: cap

Option 5 - If patient has allergy to cefazolin or severe delayed reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis) AND GBS positive sensitive to clindamycin
clindamycin
900 mg, IV, q8h, order duration: 6 doses or times
erythromycin EC
333 mg, PO, q8h, order duration: 10 day, drug form: cap
Select betamethasone for patients at 24+0 to 34+6 weeks gestation if not already received
betamethasone
12 mg, IM, q24h, order duration: 2 doses or times, drug form: inj
Consults/Referrals
Consider consultation with Maternal Fetal Medicine or Neonatology where available
